case.summary: The accused, a 50-year-old married man with two adult children, pleaded guilty to possession of oxycontin and presently came before the court for sentencing -- He said he was going to sell the tablets at the request of a friend -- The accused admitted he had his own prescription for the drug, that he contemplated the monetary value of the pills, and that he had a gambling problem -- The parties agreed to make a joint submission seeking a 12 month sentence to be served in the community -- HELD: The accused was given a 12-month conditional sentence and ordered to pay a $1,000 fine -- The accused was a first-time offender who had shown remorse -- There was no evidence he was a drug abuser or a drug trafficker -- He was manipulated by his friend to sell the drug -- The court was satisfied he could serve a conditional sentence without endangering the safety of the community.
